cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move WNW just north of Cuba, turn NW near the Florida Keys Saturday and track north-northwest toward the eastern Gulf and the Florida Panhandle, then weaken inland across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend / Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest Florida coast from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef; parts of central Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern coast of Cuba, the Florida Keys, Southwest and West Florida coast, and eventually the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph mid-week
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of remnant moisture may produce 1–3 inches of rain over northwest Ohio mid-week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor localized ponding on terminal surfaces possible during heavier downpours
